modules.description: The module offers functions to convert duration values into multiple time units (e.g., days, hours, seconds) and format them as strings or JSON, enabling precise time component extraction. It operates on a type `t` representing durations, though no internal data manipulation is specified. Use cases include logging, user-facing time displays, and API data serialization where structured time representations are required.

This module enables manipulation and comparison of date/time values through operations like adding durations, adjusting time units (e.g., day, month, hour), and querying specific components (year, minute, millisecond). It supports both immutable transformations and in-place modifications, along with timezone conversions, locale-based formatting, and precise granularity-controlled comparisons. Use cases include scheduling, logging with timestamp adjustments, and internationalization tasks requiring localized date representations.

The module provides functions to convert duration values into various time units (days, hours, minutes, seconds, etc.) and format them as strings or ISO strings, enabling consistent representation across different scales. It operates on a type `t` that encapsulates duration data, though no direct manipulation of this type is defined. Use cases include displaying human-readable time intervals or standardizing duration data for logging, user interfaces, or data exchange.

This module offers operations to manipulate and query date-time values, including adjusting durations, setting time components (e.g., day, hour, month), and aligning to interval boundaries (e.g., start/end of day). It works with a `t` type representing temporal moments, supporting both immutable transformations and in-place modifications. Use cases include timezone conversions, precise time comparisons, and formatting for ISO/Unix standards, alongside granular control over date arithmetic and component-specific adjustments.

Provides functions to parse, format, and manipulate date and time values using Moment.js capabilities. Works with native OCaml strings, integers, and custom date objects derived from JavaScript's Date type. Enables tasks such as generating localized time strings, calculating time differences, and adjusting date values by specific intervals.

provides functions to convert and manipulate time durations and date/time values, supporting operations like unit conversion, time adjustment, and formatting. It defines a duration type `t` and offers methods to extract and represent time components in various formats, including JSON and locale-specific strings. Users can add durations to timestamps, adjust time units, and perform precise comparisons with timezone awareness. Examples include generating human-readable logs, scheduling events, and serializing time data for internationalized applications.

Encapsulates duration and date-time manipulation, offering conversions between time units and precise temporal adjustments. It works with a `t` type for duration and another `t` type for date-time, enabling operations like formatting, component extraction, and interval alignment. Users can convert durations to readable strings, adjust date-time values by specific intervals, and align moments to calendar boundaries. Examples include generating ISO-formatted durations, calculating time differences, and setting specific hours or days in a date-time value.
